document.docAuthor: Motamedinia, Behnam, Skevington, Jeffrey H. & Kelso, Scott
document.masterDocTitle: Revision of Tomosvaryella Aczél (Diptera: Pipunculidae) in the Middle East, with description of 19 new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of Tomosvaryella Aczél (Diptera: Pipunculidae) in the Middle East, with description of 19 new species

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Tomosvaryella glabrum ( Adams, 1905 )
.—syn.
Kehlmaier et al. (2019)

.

Tomosvaryella tecta De Meyer, 1993
.—syn.
De Meyer et al. (2000)

.

subSubSection.paragraph: Diagnosis: This species can be recognized by the asymmetrical and irregular-shaped surstyli in dorsal view ( Fig.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 31. Male genitalia of
Tomosvaryella pilosiventris
(JSS52065, TAU) A) dorsal view, B) ventral view, C) ejaculatory apodeme, D, E) lateral view.

Distribution: Egypt , Iran , Israel , Kenya , South Africa , Spain ( Canary Islands ), Syria , Turkey , United Arab Emirates , West Bank , Zimbabwe (
Kehlmaier et al. 2019
; Skevington 2020 ) ( Fig. 61 ).

Notes: DNA barcodes of
T. pilosiventris
overlap with
T. subvirescens
(0.3–1.9% pairwise divergence). Despite this, the genitalia of these species are rather different. This is thus likely a case of recently diverged species, as seen in many other taxa (e.g.
Skevington et al. 2007, Young et al. 2016 , Motamedinia et al. 2020
). There is always a possibility that it is a single species with polymorphic genitalia, so future genetic work may shed light on this issue.
